dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3286 IH: HIRE Vets Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cook (for himself and Ms. Gabbard) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To encourage effective, voluntary private sector investments to recruit, employ, and retain men and women who have served in the United States military with annual presidential awards to private sector employers recognizing such efforts, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Honoring Investments in Recruiting and Employing American Military Veterans Act of 2015 or the HIRE Vets Act.

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Labor shall establish, by rule, a HIRE Vets Medallion Program to solicit voluntary information from employers for purposes of recognizing, by means of an award to be designated a HIRE Vets Medallion, verified efforts by such employers—

paragraph.text: to recruit, employ, and retain veterans; and
to provide community and charitable services supporting the veteran community.

subsection.text: Beginning in the calendar year following the calendar year in which the Secretary establishes the program—

paragraph.text: the Secretary shall annually—

subparagraph.text: solicit and accept voluntary applications from employers in order to consider whether those employers should receive a HIRE Vets Medallion;
review applications received in each calendar year; and
provide to the President a list of recipients; and

paragraph.text: the President shall annually—

subparagraph.text: notify such recipients of their awards; and
at a time to coincide with the annual commemoration of Veterans Day—

clause.text: announce the names of such recipients;
recognize such recipients through publication in the Federal Register; and
issue to each such recipient—

subclause.text: a HIRE Vets Medallion of the level determined under section 3; and
a certificate stating that such employer is entitled to display such HIRE Vets Medallion during the following calendar year, to be designated a HIRE Vets Medallion Certificate.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall solicit applications not later than January 31st of each calendar year for the medallions to be awarded in November of that calendar year.
The Secretary shall stop accepting applications not earlier than April 30th of each calendar year for the medallions to be awarded in November of that calendar year.
The Secretary shall finish reviewing applications not later than August 31st of each calendar year for the medallions to be awarded in November of that calendar year.

The Secretary shall provide to the President a list of employers to receive HIRE Vets Medallions not later than September 30th of each calendar year for the medallions to be awarded in November of that calendar year.
The President shall notify employers who will receive HIRE Vets Medallions not later than October 11th of each calendar year for the medallions to be awarded in November of that calendar year.
The Secretary shall review all applications received in a calendar year to determine whether an employer should receive a HIRE Vets Medallion, and, if so, of what level.

The Secretary shall require that all applications provide information on the programs and other efforts of applicant employers during the calendar year prior to that in which the medallion is to be awarded, including the categories and activities governing the level of award for which the applicant is eligible under subsection (b).

In reviewing applications, the Secretary shall verify all information provided in the applications, to the extent that such information is relevant in determining whether or not an applicant should receive a HIRE Vets Medallion or in determining the appropriate level of HIRE Vets Medallion for that employer to receive.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall establish four levels of HIRE Vets Medallions to be awarded to employers employing 500 or more employees, to be designated the Bronze HIRE Vets Medallion, the Silver HIRE Vets Medallion, the Gold HIRE Vets Medallion, and the Platinum HIRE Vets Medallion.
No employer shall be eligible to receive a Bronze HIRE Vets Medallion in a given calendar year unless—

clause.text: such employer has hired a veteran during the previous calendar year;

such employer provides support to each of its employees who are performing active duty service in the United States National Guard or Reserve, including by providing to each such employee a guarantee of employment following such employee’s active duty service; and
such employer provides charitable resources in support of veteran support organizations.

subparagraph.text: No employer shall be eligible to receive a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion in a given calendar year unless—

clause.text: such employer is eligible to receive a Bronze HIRE Vets Medallion in such year;
veterans constitute not less than 5 percent of all employees hired by such employer during the prior calendar year;
such employer retains through the end of the prior calendar year not less than 75 percent of veteran employees hired during the calendar year before the prior calendar year; and
such employer provides a targeted training program for new veteran employees.

subparagraph.text: No employer shall be eligible to receive a Gold HIRE Vets Medallion in a given calendar year unless—

clause.text: such employer is eligible to receive a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion in such year;
veterans constitute not less than 7 percent of all employees hired by such employer during the prior calendar year;
such employer has established an employee veteran organization or resource group to assist new veteran employees with integration, including coaching and mentoring; and
such employer has established programs to enhance the leadership skills of veteran employees during their employment.

subparagraph.text: No employer shall be eligible to receive a Platinum HIRE Vets Medallion in a given calendar year unless—

clause.text: such employer is eligible to receive a Gold HIRE Vets Medallion in such year;
veterans constitute not less than 10 percent of all employees hired by such employer during the prior calendar year;
such employer retains through the end of the prior calendar year not less than 85 percent of veteran employees hired during the calendar year before the prior calendar year;
such employer employs dedicated human resources professionals to support hiring and retention of veteran employees, including efforts focused on veteran hiring and training;

such employer provides each of its employees serving on active duty in the United States National Guard or Reserve with compensation sufficient, in combination with the employee’s active duty pay, to achieve a combined level of income commensurate with the employee’s salary prior to undertaking active duty; and
such employer has established a tuition assistance program to support veteran employees’ attendance in postsecondary education during the term of their employment.

subparagraph.text: An employer shall be deemed to meet the requirements of subparagraph (E)(iv) if such employer—

clause.text: employs 5,000 or fewer employees; and
employs at least one human resources professional whose regular work duties include those described under subparagraph (E)(iv).

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may provide, by rule, additional criteria with which to determine qualifications for receipt of each level of HIRE Vets Medallion.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall establish similar awards in order to recognize achievements in supporting veterans by—

subparagraph.text: employers with 50 or fewer employees; and
employers with more than 50 but fewer than 500 employees.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall establish the shape, form, and metallic content of each HIRE Vets Medallion.
The recipient of a HIRE Vets Medallion may—

paragraph.text: publicly display such medallion through the end of the calendar year following receipt of such medallion; and
publicly display the HIRE Vets Medallion Certificate issued in conjunction with such medallion.

subsection.text: It is unlawful for any employer to publicly display a HIRE Vets Medallion—

paragraph.text: if such employer did not receive such medallion through the HIRE Vets Medallion Program; or
after the end of the calendar year following the calendar year in which such medallion was issued to such employer through the HIRE Vets Medallion Program.

subsection.text: The Secretary may assess a reasonable fee on employers that apply for receipt of a HIRE Vets Medallion.
There is established in the Treasury of the United States a separate account for the deposit of fees collected under subsection (a), to be designated the HIRE Vets Medallion Award Fund.
The Secretary shall deposit any fees collected pursuant to subsection (a) into the HIRE Vets Medallion Award Fund.

subparagraph.text: There are authorized to be appropriated for the first fiscal year in which applications are to be solicited under section 2(b) such sums as may be necessary to carry out this Act in such fiscal year.

There is authorized to be appropriated from the HIRE Vets Medallion Award Fund, for each fiscal year following a fiscal year in which fees are collected under subsection (a), an amount equal to the total fees collected under subsection (a) during such prior fiscal year.

paragraph.text: Amounts appropriated pursuant to paragraph (1) are authorized to remain available until expended.
Amounts appropriated pursuant to paragraph (1) shall be used for carrying out the HIRE Vets Medallion Program.

subsection.text: Beginning not later than two years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to Congress annual reports on—

paragraph.text: the fees collected from applicants for HIRE Vets Medallions in the prior year and any changes in fees to be proposed in the present year;
the cost of administering the HIRE Vets Medallion Program in the prior year;
the number of applications for HIRE Vets Medallions received in the prior year; and
the HIRE Vets Medallions awarded in the prior year, including the name of each employer to whom a HIRE Vets Medallion was awarded and the level of medallion awarded to each such employer.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall provide the reports required under subsection (a) to the Chairman and Ranking Member of—

paragraph.text: the Committees on Education and the Workforce and Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives; and
the Committees on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions and Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate.

subsection.text: The term employer has the meaning given such term under section 4303 of title 38, United States Code, except that such term does not include—

paragraph.text: the Federal Government;
any State, as defined in such section; or
any foreign state.

subsection.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of Labor.
The term veteran has the meaning given such term under section 101 of title 38, United States Code.
